answers.answer: Many ophthalmic and brain disorders can cause acute vision loss, but systemic disease may also cause blindness.Your dog should have a complete ophthalmic and physical exam as well as diagnostics such as blood work.Systemic diseases that may include or contribute to blindness are:1.  viruses (distemper, infectious hepatitis),2.  rickettsial diseases (ehrlichiosis and Rocky Mountain spotted fever),3.  bacteria ( Borrelia burgdorferi ),4.  fungi ( Blastomyces , Coccidioides , Histoplasma , Cryptococcus , and Aspergillus ), 5.  protozoa ( Toxoplasma , Neospora , Leishmania , and Hepatozoon )6.  algae ( Prototheca ),7.  parasites ( Dirofilaria , Toxocara , and Diptera spp ).8.  Many metabolic diseases : diabetes mellitus,  hyperadrenocorticism, hypothyroidism.9.  Others:   intraocular hemorrhages from elevated systemic blood pressure, and  blood and vascular disorders which can cause intraocular hemorrhage, retinal detachment.Primary causes of blindness include: SARDS (Sudden Acquired Retinal Degeneration), Glaucoma, head trauma, and trauma to the eyes themselves or to the optic nerve, including optic nerve degeneration, and others.Acute blindness is a medical emergency and requires immediate care to try and get the sight back, depending on the cause.  Some causes are reversible, but many are not.Please go to an emergency or a referral clinic (with an ophthalmologist on staff) ASAP.Last words:  Blind dogs can live long and happy lives, and adapt very well.  Dogs sense of smell is so powerful that they can get actual visual images from smells that acts like sonar.

question: Our 3 year old German Shepard woke up this morning and appears to be blind.  His pupils are dilated, he's bumping into things and appears to come to us just by our voices.  Otherwise he appears "normal", playing with our other dog, barking at noises, drinking and eating.  Historically health wise he has had a slight heart murmur since birth, otherwise healthy.  We cannot think of anything he could have injested, other than possibly drinking out of a toilet.  Does anyone have any ideas?
title: Help for our german shepard!
